text:
``` <@U0914MEN7> you have any other thoughts here? 


Thanks for reaching on the PAM build! We've dug back in to the RFP scope and have some thoughts on how we could work together to bring this to life.

From our end, we took a look at what would be needed to build this out, and try and get something closer to the $200k budget you proposed. A rough timeline would be as follows:

Weeks 1-3 - initial design, BLE connectivity interfacing
Weeks 4-6 - control panel implementation
Weeks 7-10 - if/then programming interface implementation 
Weeks 11-14 - QA, testing, refinement
Week 15 - Launch submission

To bring scope more in line with budget expectations, we would propose the following caveats:

- Platforms would be limited to iOS, iPhone only.
- As such, windows and android applications are not considered in the budget. We'd expect users to upload sketches via the Arduino IDE or for the hardware to come preloaded.
- For the If/Then language, we'd want to look at simplifying this to one-level deep for UI, UX, and technical complexity. 

The total cost for this would be $290,000. We understand that's still above your budget range, but want to be transparent about the effort we believe an undertaking such as this would require. Below is a breakdown of our staffing allocations, as a percentage of overall timeline. These would ebb and flow as work needs, but generally represents the allocations we would apply.

Design Director 	10%
Designer 		22.5%
Producer 		20%
CTO 			2.5%
iOS Developer #1 	40%
QA 			5%

Thank you again for your consideration for PAM â€“ it's an exciting project that we would love to help bring to life. Let us know if you have any questions.

Thanks,
Charles
```
I hope it comes back with drool on it
it's a bit of a bummer, but yes, good for me unless aves has feedback
